38  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::low_n_rates[32] = { 57.32484, 146.49681, 286.6242 , 452.2293 , 630.57324,
39  802.5478 , 968.1529 , 1101.9109 , 1210.191 , 1292.9937 ,
40  1350.3185 , 1394.9044 , 1420.3822 , 1433.121 , 1433.121 ,
41  1420.3822 , 1407.6433 , 1382.1656 , 1356.6879 , 1324.8408 ,

43  1121.0192 , 1089.172 , 1050.9554 , 1019.1083 , 987.26117,
44  961.78345, 923.5669 };

46  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::p_coefficients[3][4] = { {5.8664e8,-0.3634 ,-16.704,51.07 },
47  {5.4448e9,-0.03953,-1.5171,5.115 },
48  {1.9153e9,-0.11334,-3.1140,12.913}
49  };
50  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::b_ion[3][3][3] = {{{13.9123, -21.8262, 10.2640},
51  {-27.3489, 55.6957, -29.5954}, // s
52  {12.9176, -26.3804, 13.6662}},
53 
54  {{1.4983,-2.3516,1.1062},
55  {-3.1134,6.4271,-3.4492}, // p
56  {1.4554,-3.0090,1.5756}},
57 
58  {{ 4.3096, -6.7807, 3.1954},
59  { -8.4080, 17.2370, -9.2097}, // d
60  { 3.8665, -7.9279, 4.1228}}};

62  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::q_0 = 4./3.;
63  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::A = 560./9.;
64  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::B = 500./3.;
65 
66 
67  void KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::CalculateLifeTime( const KSParticle& aParticle,
68  double& aLifeTime )
69  {
70  long long tPID = aParticle.GetPID();
71  if ( (tPID == fTargetPID && fTargetPID != 0) || ( (tPID >= fminPID) && ( tPID <= fmaxPID)) )
72  {
73  int n = aParticle.GetMainQuantumNumber();
74  // int l = aParticle.GetSecondQuantumNumber();
75 
76  if( n > 40) {
77  aLifeTime = 1. / (CalculateSpontaneousDecayRate(n, 1)
78  * CalculateRelativeIonisationRate(n, 1, fTemperature));
79  }else {
80  if(n >= 9) {
81  aLifeTime = 1. / low_n_rates[n - 9];
82  } else
83  {
84  intmsg( eError ) << "ionisation rate not implemented for n < 9" << eom;
85  }
86 
87  }
88 
89  } else
90  {
91  aLifeTime = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
92  }
93  return;
94  }
95 
96  void KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle,
97  KSParticle& aFinalParticle,
98  KSParticleQueue& aSecondaries)
99  {
100  aFinalParticle.SetTime( anInitialParticle.GetTime() );
101  aFinalParticle.SetPosition( anInitialParticle.GetPosition() );
102  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( anInitialParticle.GetMomentum() );
103 
104  if ( (anInitialParticle.GetPID() == fTargetPID && fTargetPID != 0) || ( (anInitialParticle.GetPID() >= fminPID) && ( anInitialParticle.GetPID() <= fmaxPID)) )
105  {
106  double tTime = aFinalParticle.GetTime();
107  KThreeVector tPosition = aFinalParticle.GetPosition();
108 
109  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
110  aFinalParticle.SetActive(false);
111 
112  fStepNDecays = 1;
113  fStepEnergyLoss = 0.;
114 
115  if(fDecayProductGenerator != NULL)
116  {
117  KSParticleQueue tDecayProducts;
118 
119  fDecayProductGenerator->ExecuteGeneration(tDecayProducts);
120 
121  KSParticleIt tParticleIt;
122  for( tParticleIt = tDecayProducts.begin(); tParticleIt != tDecayProducts.end(); tParticleIt++ )
123  {
124  (*tParticleIt)->SetTime((*tParticleIt)->GetTime()+tTime);
125  (*tParticleIt)->SetPosition((*tParticleIt)->GetPosition()+tPosition);
126  }
127 
128  aSecondaries = tDecayProducts;
129  }
130  }
131 
132  return;
133  }
134 
135  void KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::SetDecayProductGenerator( KSGenerator* aGenerator )
136  {
137  if( fDecayProductGenerator == NULL )
138  {
139  fDecayProductGenerator = aGenerator;
140  return;
141  }
142  intmsg( eError ) << "cannot set decay product generator <" << aGenerator->GetName() << "> to decay calculator <" << GetName() << ">" << eom;
143  return;
144  }
145 
146  KSGenerator* KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::GetDecayProductGenerator() const
147  {
148  return fDecayProductGenerator;
149  }
150 
151  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::CalculateSpontaneousDecayRate( int n, int l)
152  {
153  if (l > 2 || l < 0 || n<0)
154  intmsg(eError) << GetName() << ": Only l states 0,1,2 available for Rydberg decay" << eom;
155 
156  return p_coefficients[l][0]/(n*n*n)*(1.+p_coefficients[l][1]/n+p_coefficients[l][2]/(n*n)+p_coefficients[l][3]/(n*n*n));
157  }
158 
159  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::tau_tilde(double T)
160  {
161  return std::sqrt(100.0/T);
162  }
163 
164  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::a_ion(int l,int i,double T)
165  {
166  double tTauTilde = tau_tilde(T);
167  return b_ion[l][i][0]+b_ion[l][i][1]*tTauTilde+b_ion[l][i][2]*tTauTilde*tTauTilde;
168  }
169 
170  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::q(double T)
171  {
172  return q_0-A/(T+B);
173  }
174 
175  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::y(int n, double T)
176  {
177  return 157890.0/(n*n*T);
178  }
179 
180  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation::CalculateRelativeIonisationRate(int n, int l, double T)
181  {
182  if (l > 2 || l < 0 || n<0)
183  intmsg(eError) << "KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovIonisation: Only l states 0,1,2 available for Rydberg decay" << eom;
184 
185  return (a_ion(l,0,T)+a_ion(l,1,T)*y(n,T)+a_ion(l,2,T)*y(n,T)*y(n,T))
186 
187  /(std::pow(n,q(T))*(std::exp(y(n,T))-1));
188 
189  }
190 }
